pageContext.claim: “But if you look at Idlib Province in Syria, I stopped the slaughter of perhaps 3 million people. Nobody talk about that. They don't talk about that. Russia and Iran and Syria were going to go in and perhaps destroy 3 million people in order to get 45,000 terrorists.”
pageContext.analysis: There’s no clear evidence that Trump’s tweets directly or indirectly averted the Syrian government’s planned attack on Idlib province. Syrian government forces and their allies aimed to recapture the remaining rebel territory, but the crisis was averted when Turkey agreed to send its own troops in order to create a demilitarized zone from “radical” rebels and avoid a potential refugee crisis. While jihadists are intermixed within those who oppose the Syrian government, they are not necessarily one in the same.
